title: Epic: Repo consistency + link health alignment
description:
Audit findings (2026-01-31):

- README passes pattern-spec + hyperlink tests (including slow external link check).
- 65 broken internal/relative links across 20 non-README markdown files (mostly stale anchors/paths from pre-migration naming).
- Stable example directories are named correctly, but almost all example READMEs still use pre-migration pattern names (e.g., 'Rules as Code', 'AI Security Sandbox', etc.) and contain stale links.
- Experimental docs/examples still reference old pattern names/anchors and some example READMEs reference missing files.
- CLAUDE.md repo tree is out of date vs current directories.
- index.html drifts from README (missing patterns + category mismatch).

Goal: bring docs/examples/tests/scripts into alignment with pattern-spec.md conventions (names, links, structure) and ensure link integrity repo-wide.

Acceptance:
- All markdown internal/relative links validate repo-wide.
- Examples/docs use current pattern names + anchors.
- CI/tests cover links beyond README.

title: Fix placeholder links in pattern-spec.md
description:
pattern-spec.md currently contains markdown links that are meant to be examples/placeholders (e.g., [Pattern Name](#pattern-name-anchor), examples/pattern-name/). These render as broken links in link-audit tooling and undermine the spec’s own link-integrity guidance.

Scope:
- pattern-spec.md: ensure example link syntax is presented as code/escaped text (not clickable broken links).

Notes:
- Link audit currently reports 4 broken internal/relative links in pattern-spec.md (missing internal anchor + missing file).
acceptance_criteria:
- pattern-spec.md contains no broken internal/relative links when running a repo-wide markdown link audit (excluding code blocks).
- Example link formats remain clear (prefer code formatting/backticks or escaping).

title: Update experiments/examples/README.md to current experimental catalog
description:
experiments/examples/README.md appears to be from a pre-migration state and references:
- Experimental pattern names that no longer exist (e.g., AI Workflow Orchestration, Comprehensive AI Testing Strategy).
- Example directories that do not exist (e.g., human-ai-handoff/, comprehensive-ai-testing-strategy/).
- Broken links to stable examples (e.g., ../../examples/specification-driven-development/).

Scope:
- Rewrite the table to match the current experiments/README.md pattern list and the actual directory names under experiments/examples/.
- Fix links to stable examples to use existing paths and current anchors.
acceptance_criteria:
- experiments/examples/README.md accurately reflects experiments/examples/* directory names.
- All links in experiments/examples/README.md resolve (repo-wide markdown link audit shows 0 broken links).
- Terminology matches the current experimental pattern names (no legacy AI-prefixed names unless explicitly called out as history).

title: Complete asynchronous-research example directory or remove dead links
description:
experiments/examples/asynchronous-research/README.md links to multiple files that are not present in the repo (setup/*.md, example-research-tasks/*/prompt.md, automation/summarize-workflow.yml). The directory currently contains only README.md.

Scope options:
A) Add the referenced files/directories with minimal working content, consistent with the README.
B) If the full implementation is not ready, update README.md to remove/replace links and clearly mark the example as a stub.

Goal: avoid dead links and keep experimental examples trustworthy.
acceptance_criteria:
- Repo-wide markdown link audit shows 0 missing-file links for experiments/examples/asynchronous-research/README.md.
- The directory either contains the referenced files or the README no longer references them.
- Example directory passes ExampleDirectoryValidator expectations (README present, no obvious dead references).

title: Update experimental example READMEs to current names + anchors
description:
Several tracked experimental example READMEs and example docs still reference legacy pattern names/anchors (ai-*, AI-Driven, etc.) and/or legacy pattern names in headings.

Known broken-link files from link audit:

- experiments/examples/handoff-protocols/README.md (links to ../../README.md#human-ai-handoff-protocol)
- experiments/examples/workflow-orchestration/README.md (links to ../../README.md#ai-workflow-orchestration)
- experiments/examples/review-automation/README.md (links to ../../README.md#ai-review-automation)

Scope:
- Update these docs to reference current canonical pattern anchors in README and experiments/README.
- Update H1s where they still use legacy names (e.g., “AI Review Automation Implementation” -> “Review Automation Implementation”).
acceptance_criteria:
- All tracked experimental example docs use current pattern names.
- Repo-wide markdown link audit shows 0 missing-target-anchor failures for experiments/examples/**.
- No references to non-existent README anchors (ai-*, specification-driven-development, etc.).

title: Register pytest markers (slow) to remove warnings
description:
Running pytest currently emits PytestUnknownMarkWarning for pytest.mark.slow used in tests/test_links.py.

Scope:
- Add pytest configuration (pytest.ini or pyproject.toml) to register the slow marker (and any other custom markers in use).
- Ensure CI commands using -m slow / -m "not slow" continue to work without warnings.
acceptance_criteria:
- pytest runs without PytestUnknownMarkWarning for slow marker.
- test_links.py still supports selecting slow vs not slow.

title: Add repo-wide markdown link validation (docs/examples/experiments)
description:
Current CI/test coverage validates links mainly in README.md. A repo-wide audit found 65 broken internal/relative links across 20 non-README markdown files.

Scope:
- Add a new pytest test (or extend existing link checker) to validate internal anchors + relative file links across markdown files in:
  - docs/
  - examples/
  - experiments/
  - pattern-spec.md and other top-level docs
- Exclude code blocks and known placeholder/example snippets.
- Integrate into GitHub Actions (pattern-validation.yml) so broken links are caught in PRs.

Sequencing note:
- This should likely be enabled after existing broken links are fixed, otherwise it will fail immediately.
acceptance_criteria:
- A new test exists that validates internal/relative links across non-README markdown.
- GitHub Actions runs the test and fails on broken links.
- The test has reasonable exclusions (code blocks, explicit placeholder examples) and low flakiness.

title: Normalize Python invocation in GitHub Actions workflows
description:
In .github/workflows/pattern-validation.yml, most jobs use python3, but the quality-gates job uses plain python for pytest invocations. This can be brittle across runner images.

Scope:
- Use python3 consistently in workflow steps.
- Optionally ensure the same virtualenv/dependencies are used for quality-gates steps.

Goal: avoid environment-dependent failures.
acceptance_criteria:
- pattern-validation.yml uses consistent python3 invocation.
- Workflow continues to run the same tests as before.

title: Harden example-validation against local stray directories
description:
Local test run showed Example Code Validation failing due to directories that exist on disk but are not tracked in git (e.g., examples/ai-issue-generation/, examples/ai-context-persistence/, experiments/examples/ai-event-automation/), each missing README.md.

These directories are likely leftovers from earlier migrations or local experimentation; they are empty or contain only ignored files, so git status stays clean, but ExampleDirectoryValidator still scans them.

Options:
- Update ExampleDirectoryValidator to only validate git-tracked example directories (or only directories containing a README.md).
- Or document a cleanup step / add a guard that warns when such stray dirs exist.

Goal: make local validation predictable and aligned with CI behavior.
acceptance_criteria:
- Running tests/run_all_tests.py on a working tree with stray empty example dirs does not fail Example Code Validation (or fails with a clear actionable message).
- CI behavior remains unchanged.

title: Fix docs/claude-code-guide.md TOC anchors
description:
docs/claude-code-guide.md has a manually-maintained Table of Contents whose anchors do not match the document headings (likely due to emoji in headings causing the TOC to include a leading hyphen / variation selector). Link audit reports 10 missing internal anchors at the top of the file.

Scope:

- Also convert the single external YouTube link that uses http:// to https://.

Notes:

acceptance_criteria:

- Repo-wide markdown link audit reports 0 broken internal anchors for docs/claude-code-guide.md.
- No remaining http:// external links for that YouTube entry.

title: Align index.html with README pattern taxonomy
description:
index.html appears to be a GitHub Pages landing page but currently drifts from README:
- It omits several patterns entirely (e.g., Planned Implementation, Choice Generation, Constrained Generation, Guided Architecture, Error Resolution).
- It classifies Context Persistence as a Foundation pattern even though README categorizes it under Development.
- Pattern count badge is hard-coded (22) and may drift if patterns change.

Scope:

- Consider making pattern count and lists generated or clearly documented to avoid drift.
acceptance_criteria:
- index.html pattern lists are consistent with README (either complete or clearly stated as intentionally partial).
- Pattern categories in index.html match README taxonomy.
- Pattern count badge cannot silently drift (auto-generated or documented update step).

title: Reconcile PATTERN_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md and migration scripts
description:
PATTERN_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md and scripts/*renames*.sh appear to describe/encode a migration to two-word naming, but multiple parts conflict with current README/pattern-spec:
- Guide references pattern names/anchors that no longer exist (e.g., Spec-First) while README uses Spec-Driven Development.
- Several examples/experiments still contain legacy names even though the guide claims repository references were updated.

Scope:
- Decide whether PATTERN_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md is historical (archive it) or should reflect the current canonical names.
- Update or retire scripts/apply-pattern-renames.sh and scripts/apply-experimental-renames.sh accordingly.
- Update scripts/README.md examples that reference the old pattern count (21) to current count.

Goal: remove confusion for readers and prevent future drift.
acceptance_criteria:
- Migration guide either (a) matches the current canonical naming/anchors, or (b) is clearly marked as historical and moved/segmented accordingly.
- Any referenced “new names” in the guide exist in README.
- Migration scripts are either updated to current names or clearly archived with warnings.
- scripts/README.md examples reflect current pattern count.

This is a high-impact consistency fix because Security Sandbox is a foundational pattern.

- examples/security-sandbox/README.md accurately lists files that exist.
